ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: We learned about the impact of trade between big/little countries (i.e. countries with and without a lot of influence on the trade market) affect different facets of society from domestic and foreign workers in applicable industries, consumers in the countries with different trading power, the government, overall welfare and more.
I learned a lot about international trade policy and how it applies to trade conflicts.
About effects on trade policy : welfare, wages, barriers etc
Knowledge of various trade models as they pertain to real life political economies

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This is a very chill coarse work wise, but you can learn a a lot from the topic which is great. There were only 2/3 homework assignments over the semester and a final group project (presentation and paper) at the end of the semester. The only thing to take note of is that since it's a seminar that only meets once a week, sometimes it feels like class goes on forever.
Professor Maggi is fantastic. Wish there had been more discussion.
It's a stress free class. The professor is pretty nice and that makes learning much more enjoyable

Strengths: interesting final project and problem sets, though would be more interesting if there were more problem sets over the course of the semester (perhaps more shorter ones instead of two longer ones). Prof Maggi is very interesting Weaknesses: a lot of overlap with Econ 184 (international econ)

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! It's an enjoyable course, not too much work and the professor is great.
Yes, but it is not very challenging.
Yes, absolutely! Professor knows what hes talking about and the class is relaxed in a way that makes it easy to learn
Yeah! I think trade policy is for every econ graduate. You can develop pretty good insights which will take you far

Maggi is wonderful and incredibly knowledgeable. Class is generally a lecture format, which can be tough for the whole length of a seminar if trade policy does not particularly interest you. Workload is very manageable.
